value: Design for an Embroidered or Woven Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: A horizontal row, composed of a landscape with four trees of which one is a palm, and with a flying bird, is flanked by two fantastical plants with bunches of seeds of different designs. One unit and the left part of another are shown. A row of beads is at the bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Embroidery, Gentleman's Waistcoat Pocket

label: Description
value: The waistcoat or gilet pocket flap shows garlands of light green leaves, while the area of the pocket below the flap contains garlands of yellow flowers. The flap shows a bird on the left, a bird and shovel upon a flower basket in the center, and a tree on the right. The area below the pocket flap includes rabbits, assorted birds, and a mouse in a trap. Lilac edges with rows of yellow beads and purple, blue, and yellow floral garlands appear along the edge of the waistcoat pocket and pocket flap.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, gouache, pen and black, purple ink, and graphite on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of Wearing Apparel, No. 31, of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Four flower boughs are shown disposed in two staggered horizontal rows.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of Wearing Apparel of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Two crossing boughs at left and a bough of a tree, at right, in the top row. Two boughs in the bottom row are disposed in slightly oblique vertical rows. Three small-scale motifs form an oblique row in the interval, each of them consisting of a shell among plants and water.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of Wearing Apparel of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Flower boughs of four different designs are disposed in staggered horizontal rows. They are connected vertically by rising waves composed of garlands, leaf boughs, and pearl chains. Three horizontal rows are shown.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Embroidered Floral Motifs of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Top row, left: a festoon and a garland hang from grass, from which a plant rises; a flower bough is fastened to it. A flower motif is roughly sketched beside it with pen, ink. At right, a bunch of flowers. Staggered bottom row. At left: a flower and a bunch of flowers shown upside d own are connceted by a blue ribbon and a bough. At right: A bunch of flowers in which cornflowers are included. Verso: scale, graphite.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Embroidered Floral Motifs of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Cards fastenedd together by bow knots form irregular lozenges. A standing bunch of feather leaves and a lilac bough, horizontally disposed, alternate in those of the first row. The lozenges of the second and fourth rows show two alternating floral designs in oblique strips. Flower garlands hang in the lozenges of the third row. Somewhat more than one repeat is shown. Squared with graphie in opposite direciton. Verso: blotter of a sketch of a design of small boughs in rows. Written in graphite, bottom left: "8 fleurs". Part of a listing as at the left edge.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Embroidered Waistcoat, pattern 1819 of the Fabrique de St. Ruf, "Gilet" design

label: Description
value: A plant grows from the bottom edge, the left side boughs of which branch into the intervals between the button holes. Part of it is covered by an oblong stone trough from which plants grow and a flower festoons hangs. A laurel garland is beneath the trough. Traced flower boughs are shown in the field over it.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and gouache on white laid paper

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1920: acquired by Museum

Design for the Embroidery of the Left Side of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf," "Gilet" Design"

label: Description
value: A greenish edge and six buttonholes are shown at left. A flower stem rises beside it. Undulating rising boughs with thorns and leaves decorate the field.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line

Design for an embroidered "gilet" of the Fabrique de St. Ruf

label: Description
value: Rectangular corner, lilac edges from which plants grow, high ones beneath the pocket and an undulated thorny stem with leaves decorating the field over the pocket. A net, with birds awaiting the parent bird, on a very high plant at the left side of the pocket.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on glazed tracing paper

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1920: acquired by Museum

Design for the Embroidery of the Left Bottom Part of a Man's Waistcoat of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Lilac edges parts of which are to be paralleled by leaf staffs. Bunches of flowers are showon on the flap of the poocket, beneath its right part and in the corner. An ivy stem connects the two last ones.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on glazed tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Embroidery, Gentleman's Waistcoat Pocket

label: Description
value: Design for the embroidery of the left bottom part of a man's waistcoat or gilet featuring a pocket. The design features two fantastical peacocks preying for insects, plants, and festoons. Blue flowers and yellow leaves decorate the rectangular pocket flap, and a branch with blue flowers and yellow leaves rises above and to the left of the flap. Design includes buttonholes on the left. Verso: five yellow birds with yellow leaves rising from two of them.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, pen and brown ink, graphite on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Gilet, pattern 1732 of the Fabrique de St. Ruf

label: Description
value: Rectangular corner, but a correction of the decoration as first suggested, intended to show a blue spherical triangle in the corner. Five buttonholes are shown. Plants grow along the edges. A lilac grows to the top passing behind the oblong pocket.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for Gile, pattern 1757 of the Fabrique de St. Ruf

label: Description
value: Rectangular corner. Lilac edges; six buttonholes are shown. A vew of a garden with a fountin is shown at the bottom; a rose bush grows high up, at left. A trellis railing of a garden, with vases standing upon it, decorates the pocket. Leaf boughs grow from the rising edge. Top of a blossom and of a leaf growing from a lilac edge.  Verso: blotter of a black crayon sketch of a lady’s dress.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of a Lady's Overskirt of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Ruffled edge with a broad brown strip, the inside edge of which is formed by a flower stem from which boughs branch into strip and field. The field is decorated by a repeat composed of two flower boughs, connected by a lace cloth festoon, the right end of which is held by a button from which lace scallops hang.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for a Woven Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Nosegays, of which one is nearly entirely shown and another partially, form a vertical row connected by festoons. They are compsoed of two kinds of feathery leaves and are fastened to a bowknot with tassels and partially formed by beads. The festoons consist of a flower stem, two entwined ribbons with tassels, a chain of beads. A row of beads is at the bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and white gouache on glazed tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of a Lady's Overskirt of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Ruffled yellow edge along the rising part of which are two alternate three rings of a chain, with standing and hanging boughs and a fantastic plant. A plant is in the corner.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Design for the Embroidery of a Lady's Overskirt of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: A desnely scalloped strip, framed at the inside by a row of hands, is shown along the edge. Two different kinds of ornamentations are suggested alternatively for the scallops. A row of scallops of various heights and with floral decoration rises from the strip. Flower boughs grow from some of the intervals between scallops.

value: Graphite, brush and gouache on paper

Design for the Embroidery of a Lady's Dress of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: Three bunches of flowers and a rose bough are connected by garlands. Ther vertically alternating repeats are in opposite directions. Written in ink: "tou ce qui est peint en blanc ou jaune / dans les petites guirlandes est pour / etre brodé pané or et argent / point de dorure dans les 3 / bouquets principeaux", top right. An account "248" top left, in opposite direction. Marked with two pencil crosses, bottom right.

label: Description
value: Purse is horizontal rectangle of interlinked wire ornamented with attached spangles. Handle is a chain of linked wire.

label: Description
value: Ruby glass, hat-shaped, tall finial, upturned scalloped rim, engraved grape vine motif.

label: Provenance
value: James B. Ford; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Two vases (a,b) in baluster form with gilt decoration in Islamic style.

label: Description
value: Wide shallow bowl on flaring foot, two loop handles oriented horizontally.  Exterior decorated with two groups of young men armed with spears, facing central figure of Dionysus who holds drinking horn.  Above, a double ivy wreath border; below, meander and rays.  Interior centered with confronting cloaked figures holding spears.  Red and black on red ground.

label: Provenance
value: 1921: acquired by Museum from  Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Panel of cream and silver fabric heavily brocaded with gold thread and multicolored silks. Pattern has architectural ruins and flowers in the lower left and upper right corners while the lower right and upper left corners have trees with decorative foliage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: twill weave with supplementary weft

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James O. Green and Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Model of a Walled Entrance with Gate

label: Description
value: Model in the form of two walls surmounted by urns and punctuated with iron-decorated windows, and rusticated pilasters;  connected, as if for an entry allee by a wrought iron gate (of possible later date), the metalwork surrounded by quoined rusticated pillars supporting urns with finials (one missing, one replaced)

label: Physical description
value: Carved and painted pine, wrought iron gate and window grill

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James O. Green and Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: In late 17th-century/early 18th-century Venetian style, central vertically ovoidal moulded frame surrounded by acanthus branches; row of scallops decorates edge of opening.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James O. Green and Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Peach and metallic silver fabric in a design of a large-scale central spray of roses flanked by scalloped ribbon serpentines meeting in the center. Large roses in high relief. Metallic brocading in several kinds of gold thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: compound cloth with supplementary weft

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James O. Green and Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Deep horizontal panel of white silk with a design of double zigzag lines alternating horizontally with a row of lozenges. Multicolored silk embroidery, metallic thread and flat metal strips in a massive design of large-scale realistically rendered flowers and foliage combined with ornamental scrolls and other decorative motifs. Backed with tan linen. Band of red taffeta at top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metallic thread on a silk ground Technique: embroidered on a compound foundation

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Walter S. Gurnee

label: Description
value: Cotton leaves applied to linen net as sprays and border for a collar and cuff.

value: Medium: linen, cotton Technique: appliqué on net

label: Description
value: Collar in a design of flowers and leaves.
